commits.author: Juande Santander-Vela
commits.summary: Templates: Add document based on Memoir class
commits.body:
The [Memoir][] class supports parts, chapters, and sections. It can
easily enforce recto or verso opening of chapters and parts. The class
can also differentiate between front matter, main matter, appendices,
and back matter. This new template tries to show all that support.

[Memoir]: https://ctan.org/pkg/memoir

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
- Rephrase parts of the text
- Fix minor spelling mistakes
- Change syntax highlighting theme

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
The command “Wrap Selection In” → “Environment” now wraps the selection
inside a `center` environment by default. This makes more sense, than
the generic `environment` we used before.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
Closing the PDF Viewer when running “Watch Document” will now remove
the LaTeX bundle file (`.filename.lb`) again.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Documentation for Package: Handle unsaved files
commits.body:
Before this update the command would display an error if the current
TeX document was not already stored on disk.

Thanks to Tim Bates who reported this problem.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Clean: Support new versions of Ruby

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Tidy: Use user settings for indentation
commits.body: This update closes #165.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
The command “Clean” now also removes files with the extension `.aux`
inside subdirectories of the current location of the master file.

commits.author: heptadecagon
commits.body: Add new lines after "\cr" in addition to "\\" and "\\[...]".

commits.author: heptadecagon
commits.body:
Add keywords to accommodate commit 4218dab, where Tidy no longer
acts on commands longer than the keyword.

Includes commands of LaTeX, AMS LaTeX, AMS TeX, and plain TeX.
The list is probably not complete.

commits.author: heptadecagon
commits.summary: Tidy: Put only keywords on their own line
commits.body:
Currently, latextidy puts commands that start with a keyword on their
own line. For example, it puts \part{...} on its own line, which it
should, but also puts \partial on its own line, which it shouldn't.
This patch stops tidy from acting on words longer than the keyword.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
“Clean” now also removes files with the extension `.mw`. The minted
package creates these files if you use the option `escapeinside`.

commits.author: Samuel Coskey
commits.body:
Before this change opening the Help document would not work, if the
LateX bundle was stored on a case-sensitive file system.

commits.author: Paul Stursberg
commits.body:
The bundle grammar now correctly recognizes `textcite` and `Textcite`
as citation commands.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Clean: Do not remove files in hidden directories
commits.body:
Before this change, the command “Clean” would also remove files in
hidden directories such as `.git`. As a consequence the command could
possibly also remove important files, such as index files (`.idx`) in a
Git repository.

Thanks to Raphael Bost (@rbost) for reporting this issue.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
The command “Clean” will now also remove files that end with the
extension `vrb`. Beamer produces these auxiliary files if you create a
`frame` environment using the option `fragile`.

commits.author: André Rösti
commits.summary: Typeset & View: Do not force engine `pdflatex`
commits.body:
Before this change “Typeset & View (PDF)” would translate a file using
PDFLaTeX, if the document included the package `pstricks`. This was
even the case, if we specified a different default engine in “LaTeX” →
“Preferences”. Since nowadays the package `pstricks` should also work
in other engines, such as [XeLaTeX][], we remove this automatic engine
switch.

[XeLaTeX]: http://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/351803

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Citations: Ignore bibliography items without keys
commits.body:
Before this change the command “Citation Based on Current Word” would
fail, if a bibliography file contained a citation without a key such as

```bib
@misc {   , title = "Missing Cite Key!" }
```

. This was problematic, since some tools such as [JabRef][] allow users
to save such bibliography entries.

[JabRef]: http://www.jabref.org

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Watch Document: Format file with Perltidy

commits.author: Robert Milton
commits.body:
Tidying removes blank lines.
This amendment re-inserts two blank lines before each \section,
and one blank line before each \subsection.

commits.author: Robert Milton
commits.body:
A little hack to restore \labels adjacent to
\begin, \end, \section and suchlike.
This is so appropriate \labels remain visible when code is folded.
Without the hack all \labels get put on a separate line,
hiding them \labels when code is folded.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
Before this commit the completion commands were unable to locate
bibliography files within the TeX tree. This problem was caused by a
call to `kpsewhich` where we only provided the filename of the
bibliography file without its extension (`.bib`).

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Completion Commands: Locate files in subfolders
commits.body:
Before this change completion commands such as “Label Based on Current
Word…” could not properly locate files deep within the TeX folder
structure. This meant that the bundle would properly locate a TeX file
such as `~/Library/texmf/tex/macro.tex`, but would fail if the file was
located in the directory `~/Library/texmf/tex/latex`.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
After this change “Watch Document” also removes the bundle cache file
again (`.filename.lb`), after we close the preview program.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
Before this change “Tables” > “Reformat” would not format tables that
contain numbers inside bracket characters correctly.

For example: The command would transform the table code

```tex
\begin{tabular}{ll}
          1 & [2]\\
 3 &     4\\
\end{tabular}
```

into the following code

```tex
\begin{tabular}{ll}
1
3 & 4\\
\end{tabular}
```

. After the change the command now formats the table correctly:

```tex
\begin{tabular}{ll}
1 & [2]\\
3 &   4\\
\end{tabular}
```

.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
The command “Wrap Selection in” > “Double Quotes” now places the caret
inside the double quotes (``'') if there is no selection. Before this
change it would place the caret after the quotes. This way you had to
move the caret two places to the left to insert text between the double
quotes, which was certainly not ideal.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
The new shortcut reflects the intention of the command – wrapping the
current selection in double quotes – a little bit better than the old
one.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
Before this change menu items related to the math environment were
located in “Environments”→“Math”. Now they are directly accessible via
the main menu item “Math”.

commits.author: Max Willsey
commits.body:
The bundle supports the `verbatim` and `lstlisting` environments, the
`verb` macro, but not the `lstinline` macro. This change fixes that by
simply treating `lstinline` just like `verb`. The bundle grammar now
treats symbols like `\` and `$` – inside the `lstinline` macro – just
like other non special characters.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
Before this change we had two menu groups for commands concerning lists:

  - “Environments” → “Lists” and
  - “Lists”

. Now we have only one: “Lists”.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
Before this change, the shortcut for “Previous Cell” was `^` + `⇤`
(Reverse Tab). In theory we can enter reverse tab by combining `<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⇧`</kbd> and
`<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⇥</kbd>`. However this procedure does not work in current versions of
TextMate.

commits.author: Markus Silberstein Hont
commits.summary: Fix broken file path formatting when viewing PDF in TM
commits.body:
Calls to urllib.quote/urllib.parse.quote
(python2 and 3, respectively), would crash for file
paths containing special characters. Fix by utf-8 encoding
the file path.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.body:
“Watch Document” now properly removes auxiliary files, even if the
filename contains characters that have a special meaning inside a
regular expression. For example, if you call your master file `[A →
B].tex` and quit Skim, then TextMate will now remove auxiliary files
such as `[A → B].aux`.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: “Help”: Remove page numbers from the TOC
commits.body:
We use a single page for the whole document. Therefore the table of
content shows that every part of the document starts at page 1. While
technically correct, this is information is not very helpful 😀.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: “Help”: Use one continuous page for documentation
commits.body:
Since we read the documentation on a computer it makes no sense to use
page breaks.

commits.author: René Schwaiger
commits.summary: Add new command “Convert Symbols in Word”
commits.body:
This command acts as replacement for the macro “Convert ASCII Symbol to
LaTeX Command”. “Convert Symbols in Word / Selection” replaces special
characters and certain sequences of characters with an equivalent LaTeX
symbol. It works either on the current selection, or – if there is no
selection — on the current word.

For example, if you select the following characters:

    <=> -> → =>

and press `<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌘`</kbd> + `&`, then TextMate replaces the selection with the
following LaTeX commands:

    \Leftrightarrow \rightarrow \rightarrow \Rightarrow
